What does it mean when the `proofprotocol` is set to 2 when defining a new currency in Verus?
When the `proofprotocol` is set to 2 when defining a new currency in Verus, it means that the proof protocol is set to PROOF_CHAINID. This allows the controller of the chain ID to mint new coins.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
How can I mint new coins in a currency I created with PROOF_CHAINID as the proof protocol?

To mint new coins, you can use the `sendcurrency` command with the `mintnew` option. For example:

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```

This command will mint 10,000 new coins of the "mycoin" currency and send them to the address "mike@".

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
What is the purpose of the `definecurrency` command in Verus?

The `definecurrency` command is used to define a new currency in Verus. It allows you to specify the properties of the currency, such as its name, options, proof protocol, currencies it can be converted to, and initial supply.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
